SEARCH
Package game

Class Game

java.lang.Object
game.Game
public final class Game extends Object
The main class for the game.

As the entry point, it sets up the game world, view, and handles game state management.
  • Used for static access to the instances of GameWorld, GameView and LevelData
  • Handles switching between different levels/interfaces
Since:
2023-10-23
Version:
1.0
Author:
Alexander, Smolowitz, alexander.smolowitz@city.ac.uk

    gameTime
    A static instance of GameTime.
    Allows for the game time to act accordingly when togglePause() is called.

    gameView
    The GameView instance in which the game is displayed.
    A public static field allowing for non-static methods to be accessed by calling Game.gameView.method();

    gameWorld
    The GameWorld instance in which bodies move and interact.
    A public static field allowing for non-static methods to be accessed by calling Game.gameWorld.method();

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static void
    debugOn()
    Toggles the debug mode on and off.
    When debug mode is on, the grid resolution is set to 1, +and all bodies are outlined.
    When debug mode is off, the grid resolution is set to 0, and all bodies have setAlwaysOutline(false).
    static boolean
    exit()
    Exits the game to the MainMenu, using GameFrame.switchLayout(Environments), after confirming with the user, using a JOptionPane.
    static void
    exitToMainMenu()
    Exits the game to the main menu layout.
    Disposes of the game world and view.
    Used when gameWorld is null.
    void
    exitWindow()
    Exits the game after confirming with the user.
    Displays a confirmation dialogue and disposes the frame if the user confirms.
    The JFrame has it defaultCloseOperation set to JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE, meaning that if a Console window is open, it will also be closed.
    static Color
    getColor(boolean debugOn)
    Gets the colour for the debug mode.
    If debug mode is on, returns Color.CYAN, otherwise returns a transparent colour.

    • Game

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      public void startGame(Environments environment, int level)
      Initialises a new game world and view with the specified environment and level.
      Adds controls to the game world and sets up the view tracker.
      Parameters:
      environment - the environment of the level
      level - the level number
      See Also:
      • GameWorld
      • GameView

    • debugOn

      public static void debugOn()
      Toggles the debug mode on and off.
      When debug mode is on, the grid resolution is set to 1, +and all bodies are outlined.
      When debug mode is off, the grid resolution is set to 0, and all bodies have setAlwaysOutline(false).
      See Also:
      • Body
      • GameView

    • exitWindow

      public void exitWindow()
      Exits the game after confirming with the user.
      Displays a confirmation dialogue and disposes the frame if the user confirms.
      The JFrame has it defaultCloseOperation set to JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE, meaning that if a Console window is open, it will also be closed.
      See Also:
      • GameFrame
      • Console

    • exit

      public static boolean exit()
      Exits the game to the MainMenu, using GameFrame.switchLayout(Environments), after confirming with the user, using a JOptionPane.
      Returns:
      true if the user confirms the exit, false otherwise.

    • switchToMainMenu

      public static void switchToMainMenu()
      Switches the game to the main menu layout.
      Disposes of the game world and view.
      Used when gameWorld is running.
      See Also:
      • GameFrame.switchLayout(Environments)

    • exitToMainMenu

      public static void exitToMainMenu()
      Exits the game to the main menu layout.
      Disposes of the game world and view.
      Used when gameWorld is null.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if gameWorld is not null.
      See Also:
      • GameFrame.switchLayout(Environments)

    • togglePause

      public void togglePause()
      Toggles the game pause state.
      Pauses the game if it is running, and resumes the game if it is paused.
      Handles all necessary timers and interfaces.

    • selectNewLevelData

      public static void selectNewLevelData(String path, String backupPath)
      • Saves the current level data to the given backup path.
      • Constructs new level data using the given path
      • Saves new level data to default save location
      Parameters:
      path - the path to the new level data file.
      backupPath - the path to the backup level data file.
      See Also:
      • LevelData

      main
      Parameters:

    • isDebugOn

      public static boolean isDebugOn()
      Returns true if debug mode is on, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      boolean representing whether debug mode is on or off.

    • getScaledDimensions

      public static int[] getScaledDimensions(int width, int height, int maxWidth, int maxHeight)
      Scales the given dimensions to fit within the maximum dimensions while maintaining the aspect ratio.
      Parameters:
      width - the original width.
      height - the original height.
      maxWidth - the maximum width.
      maxHeight - the maximum height.
      Returns:
      an array containing the scaled width and height.

    • getColor

      public static Color getColor(boolean debugOn)
      Gets the colour for the debug mode.
      If debug mode is on, returns Color.CYAN, otherwise returns a transparent colour.
      Parameters:
      debugOn - the state of debug mode
      Returns:
      the colour for the debug mode
